context.p: In Managed (No VLAN) mode, Eucalyptus does not use VLANs to isolate the network bridges attached to VMs from each other. Configure each CC to use an Ethernet device that lies within the same broadcast domain as all of its NCs.
To configure for Managed (No VLAN) mode:

step.cmd: Log in to the CLC and open the /etc/eucalyptus/eucalyptus.conf file.
Navigate to the following section, uncomment and enter your IP configuration:

info.codeblock: VNET_MODE=" MANAGED-NOVLAN " VNET_SUBNET="192.168.0.0" VNET_NETMASK="255.255.0.0" VNET_DNS="<your_dns_server_ip>" VNET_ADDRSPERNET="<#_of_similtaneous_instances_per_security_group>" VNET_PUBLICIPS="<your_free_public_ip_1 your_free_public_ip_2 ..." VNET_LOCALIP="<your_public_interface's_ip>"
info.note: If VNET_ADDRESSPERNET is too large relative to VNET_NETMASK you may have very few security groups or the CLC may refuse to start altogether. If the value obtained from the integer division of the total number of IP addresses (computed from VNET_NETMASK) and the number of IP addresses per security group (specified in VNET_ADDRESSPERNET) is less than 2, the CLC will not start VMs because it believes that there are no security groups available.
